issues.description: The problem statement (and the UML) and the solution expect a StockIngredient constructor with signature StockIngredient(String, int, int). However, the template repository only provides a constructor with signature StockIngredient(String, int, int, boolean). This mismatch prevents students from implementing SealSaloon (which, per the spec, must create new StockIngredient(name, price, quantity)) because the three-argument constructor is missing in the template. Students will get compilation errors when they attempt to instantiate StockIngredient as described in the exercise.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a three-argument constructor StockIngredient(String name, int price, int quantity) to the template StockIngredient class (matching the UML and the solution), or provide an overloaded constructor that forwards to the existing strictValidation constructor with an appropriate default (e.g., strictValidation = false). This preserves the intended API from the problem statement and allows students to instantiate StockIngredient as required.
